response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Check if a number is perfect\", \"description\": \"A perfect number is a positive integer that is equal to the sum of its positive divisors, excluding itself. For example, 6 is a perfect number because its divisors are 1, 2, and 3, which add up to 6.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```\\ndef is_perfect(n: int) -> bool:\\n```\", \"code\": \"def is_perfect(n: int) -> bool:\\n    sum_divisors = 0\\n    for i in range(1, n):\\n        if n % i == 0:\\n            sum_divisors += i\\n    return sum_divisors == n\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert is_perfect(6) == True\", \"assert is_perfect(28) == True\", \"assert is_perfect(12) == False\", \"assert is_perfect(496) == True\"] }"
